full_text:
The President of Austria  is the federal head of state of Austria. Though theoretically entrusted with great power by the constitution, in practice the President acts, for the most part, merely as a ceremonial figurehead. The President of Austria is directly elected by universal adult suffrage once in every six years. The president's offices are located in the Leopoldine Wing of the Hofburg Imperial Palace, in Vienna.
Many former Presidents have gained tremendous popularity while in office, and no incumbent has ever lost a bid for re-election, though Waldheim didn't participate for another term. Five Presidents died in office and all former presidents are deceased. Since 2004 the office is occupied by social democrat Heinz Fischer.
